comments.body: I'm not sure what you check with `if want['vlan']` but it seems wrong without any explanation...

there's no explanation in the rest of the module either, so I think documenting the module is outside of the scope of this patch. In any case it basically checks that it's getting a vlan from args and such vlan is not the same as the one already existing on the bridge
The `if want['vlan']` test isn't needed. That value will default to `None` per the `argument_spec`.

from a main pythonic perspective it won't be needed, but if we remove that part it might be conflicting with some test config fixtures where want['vlan'] might be None and have['vlan'] could be a fixture, such as 0. Having this check prevents a false check there.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +142,146 @@                            commands.append(command)

            if want['vlan'] and want['vlan'] != have['vlan']:
                templatized_command = ("%(ovs-vsctl)s -t %(timeout)s"
                                       " set port %(bridge)s tag=%(vlan)s")
